cves.summary: tlslite-ng off-by-one error on mac checking

tlslite-ng is an open source python library that implements SSL and TLS cryptographic protocols. In tlslite-ng before versions 0.7.6 and 0.8.0-alpha39, the code that performs decryption and padding ch

tlslite-ng version 0.7.3 and earlier, since commit d7b288316bca7bcdd082e6ccff5491e241305233 contains a CWE-354: Improper Validation of Integrity Check Value vulnerability in TLS implementation, tlslit

readme.summary: Well-structured README with clear installation and command-line examples, but library usage section is incomplete (cuts off mid-sentence) and lacks troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: Section 5 'Getting Started with the Library' is truncated mid-sentence ('The ClientCert function without argumen'), leaving critical API documentation incomplete

common_complaints: Feature requests not implemented (brainpool TLS 1.3 sig algs pending since 2022)
Critical bugs in core functionality (min/max TLS version constraints not working)
sentiment.summary: Project shows signs of stagnation with a 3-year-old unresolved feature request and recent critical bugs receiving minimal attention, indicating declining maintainer engagement.

concerns: No commits in the past 6 months despite last commit being in November 2025
67 open issues with no activity to address them
Zero closed issues in the past 6 months indicating no maintenance
No merged PRs in the past 6 months showing no development activity
No active contributors in the past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release process has stalled
positive_signals: Project exists and has historical commit activity

readme.summary: Excellent high-level clarity and feature documentation, but lacks practical quick-start examples and installation instructions are incomplete.
readme.top_issue: No quick-start code example showing basic usage - the README mentions features but doesn't demonstrate how to actually use the library for common tasks like encrypting data or establishing a TLS connection.

common_complaints: OpenSSL version detection failures and regex parsing issues

Expired test certificates causing test failures
Lack of timely PyPI releases - fixes committed but not released
Python 3.13 compatibility unclear despite successful test runs
Unhandled exceptions (KeyError in load_private_key)
Missing build system metadata (pyproject.toml)
praise_themes: Appreciation for the library's existence and functionality
